oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Ralph Emery Interviews Bobby Bare Parts 1, 2 and 3
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording is from Ralph Emery's (entertainer) interview of Bobby Bare (performer) for the Ralph Emery Show. Tape labeled parts 4 and 5. Recording is from June 28, 1982.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ralph Emery; Bobby Bare
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Bobby Bare radio spot for the Ralph Emery Show -- (00:14) Wings of an Eagle [excerpt] (Bobby Goldsboro) [Featuring Ralph Emery and Bobby Bare introduction voiceover] -- (00:34) Emery discusses how Bare had been on the show eleven times and Bare explains the inspiration behind "New Cut Road" -- (03:00) Emery questions the inspiration behind "If You Ain't Got Nothin' (You Ain't Got Nothin' to Lose)" and Bare reflects -- (04:29) Emery inquires if Bare had been talking to Don Bowman and Emery inquires about a time the three had been together -- (06:10) Emery asks Bare about his dancing ability -- (07:54) Emery and Bare discuss how Bowman introduced Bare to Waylon Jennings when discussing "Just to Satisfy You" -- (11:01) Emery inquires about how Bare had difficulties in his youth, and how Bare created his first instrument -- (14:22) Emery invites Bare to be the disc jockey and Bare praises Lacy J. Dalton -- (15:36) Wings of an Eagle [excerpt] (Bobby Goldsboro) [Featuring Ralph Emery and Bobby Bare outro voiceover] -- (16:58) Wings of an Eagle [excerpt] (Bobby Goldsboro) [Featuring Ralph Emery and Bobby Bare introduction voiceover] -- (17:12) Emery greets Bare and both discuss how Bare might dance on the radio -- (18:39) Emery inquires about Bare's knowledge of a dog on the Ed Sullivan Show and Charlie McCarthy -- (19:55) Emery questions Bare about "New Cut Road" and the authenticity of Marie Laveau -- (22:20) Emery and Bare introduce "Alamony" -- (22:47) Emery reflects on how Shel Silverstein would sit in on Bare's interviews and heckle them -- (25:07) Emery introduces the subject of Bare growing up in the same area of Ohio to Earl Thomas Conley -- (27:00) Emery invites Bare to reflect on the first time he met Jennings -- (29:15) Emery reveals Jennings does not like the name Waylon Arnold, and Emery and Bare reflect on the Statler Brothers -- (31:21) Emery invites Bare to discuss how Tex Ritter and other road artists have an 'itch' to be on the road -- (33:04) Wings of an Eagle [excerpt] (Bobby Goldsboro) [Featuring Ralph Emery and Bobby Bare outro voiceover] -- (34:21) (Wings of an Eagle [excerpt] (Bobby Goldsboro) [Featuring Ralph Emery and Bobby Bare introduction voiceover] -- (34:35) Bare and Emery joke about the work Bare performs -- (36:03) Bare and Emery joke about the power of energy -- (37:14) Emery inquires about the meaning behind "The Winner" to Bare -- (38:21) Emery asks Bare what nickname Jeannie Bare calls him -- (39:28) Emery recalls "Food Blues" and asks Bare to recall a specific line -- (41:22) Emery asks Bare for an update on Bare impersonators -- (45:30) Emery expresses how he rarely sees Bare without a hat, and Emery recalls a time where he was in Conway Twitty's office -- (48:38) Wings of an Eagle [excerpt] (Bobby Goldsboro) [Featuring Ralph Emery and Bobby Bare outro voiceover]
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Emery, Ralph; Bare, Bobby; Bare, Bobby, 1935-;
